name: Alignment Framework Quality Rubric

criteria.name: North Star Clarity
criteria.description: North Star is inspiring yet specific and memorable

scoring.1: No North Star or completely generic/vague
scoring.2: North Star exists but generic or unmemorable
scoring.3: North Star is clear and somewhat specific
scoring.4: North Star is compelling, specific, and memorable
scoring.5: Exceptional North Star that team can recite and use for decisions

criteria.name: Value Specificity
criteria.description: Values are distinctive to this team, not generic corporate values

scoring.1: Generic values that could apply to any company
scoring.2: Some generic values with minimal context
scoring.3: Values have some specificity to this team/context
scoring.4: Values are clearly specific to this team with context
scoring.5: Exceptionally distinctive values that couldn't apply elsewhere

criteria.name: Trade-off Transparency
criteria.description: Values explicitly state what's being optimized FOR and what's de-prioritized

scoring.5: All values clearly state what's gained and what's sacrificed

criteria.name: Decision Tenet Utility
criteria.description: Decision tenets provide actionable guidance for real decisions

scoring.1: No decision tenets or purely abstract
scoring.2: Tenets exist but too vague to apply
scoring.4: Tenets address real trade-offs with clear guidance
scoring.5: Exceptional tenets that resolve actual team dilemmas

criteria.name: Behavioral Observability
criteria.description: Behaviors are concrete, observable, and measurable

scoring.1: No behaviors or purely aspirational statements
scoring.3: Some behaviors are specific and observable
scoring.4: Most behaviors are concrete and observable
scoring.5: All behaviors are specific enough to recognize in daily work

criteria.name: Immediate Applicability
criteria.description: Someone could use this framework to make a decision TODAY

scoring.1: Framework is purely aspirational, no practical use
scoring.4: Clear guidance for most common decisions
scoring.5: Exceptional practical utility for daily decision-making

criteria.name: Internal Consistency
criteria.description: No contradictions between values, tenets, and behaviors

scoring.5: Perfect coherence with explicit resolution of value conflicts

criteria.name: Distinctiveness
criteria.description: Could clearly distinguish this team from others based on these values

scoring.1: Could apply to literally any team

criteria.name: Conciseness
criteria.description: Framework is concise and memorable (1-2 pages ideally)

scoring.1: Too long (>5 pages) or too short (just platitudes)
scoring.2: Either too verbose or too sparse
scoring.3: Reasonable length but could be tighter

criteria.name: Anti-Pattern Clarity
criteria.description: Explicitly states what the team does NOT do

scoring.5: Exceptional anti-patterns that prevent common dysfunctions

thresholds.excellent: Average score ≥ 4.5 (company-wide values should aim for this)
thresholds.very_good: Average score ≥ 4.0 (most alignment frameworks should achieve this)

usage_instructions: Rate each criterion on 1-5 scale. Calculate average. For team-level alignment, minimum is 3.5. For organization-wide values that will be used in hiring/performance reviews, aim for ≥4.5. Identify lowest-scoring criteria and improve those sections before delivering.
